intro: Isoloma erianthum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are broad and often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. Isoloma erianthum is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
